thread.title: Lost Borough Pumpkin Ale shifts perspective
thread.title_full: Lost Borough Pumpkin Ale shifts perspective

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Lost Borough Pumpkin Ale shifts perspective
text:
Lost Borough has quietly been getting better. Each better is more consistent. And I've seen them experiment with some different styles during their 11-plus months in business. I have faith in brewers Zack Hill and Dan Western. I think they make some solid stuff. (Aside: I really enjoyed their Centennial SMaSH -- single malt, single hop, beer that is one right now. It was super simple. And I loved how the floral and citrus-y notes of Centennial hops shined.) LB released Scarecrow Pumpkin Ale this week. Shockingly enough, I dug it. It wasn't a typical pumpkin spice assault. Instead, this one had a nice hint of pumpkin flesh-iness (since they chopped and smoked pumpkin chunks) and the spice bill was understated. It was a nice mixture of ginger and cinnamon (and whatever else fall-like they pulled out of the spice cabinet). I really dug the firm bread-iness in the malt backbone that supported the spices well. It was a winner. And I recommend you give it a shot. It's available right now at the Atlantic Avenue brewery.
Please stay tuned to this exact channel as I will be ramping up my beer blogging. I plan to write brief reviews, industry highlights, and talk about some of the local happenings I'm excited about. And as always, please drop me a line. I love when beer turns into discussion.
WCLEVELAND@Gannett.com
